DOC.brief_summary: This is a randomized prospective clinical trial designed to determine the wound complication rates for stainless steel staples versus subcuticular suture for skin closure in the obese parturient (BMI≥ 30kg/m2) undergoing cesarean delivery.
DOC.brief_title: Sutures vs. Staples Skin Closure After C-section in Obese Patients
DOC.criteria: Inclusion criteria: 18 years or older BMI ≥ 30kg/m2 on admission to labor and delivery Patient is for scheduled cesarean delivery or in nonemergent labor but has an indication for cesarean delivery Singleton pregnancies Gestational age ≥ 24weeks Cesarean delivery performed under regional anesthesia Exclusion criteria: Refusal to participate BMI < 30kg/m2 < 24 weeks gestation Intrauterine fetal demise Chronic pain syndrome requiring chronic narcotic use Emergent clinical situations which preclude obtaining informed consent
